result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ezzie Lamont Washington Jr

records.addlTxt: Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND- EXPIRES 12-29-2022

CASE ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD VIA EMAIL. 
Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference. Court is in trial.
Defense request a  final pretrial and jury trial dates.
Defense to file Demand for Speedy Trial.
New dates confirmed with parties via email.
Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

HELD OFF THE RECORD
Defendant Ezzie Lamont Washington Jr in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Ezzie Lamont Washington Jr.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense request an adjournment for reasons presented to the court.

Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 by zoom.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ezzie Lamont Washington Jr in court, in custody.  
Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Ezzie Lamont Washington Jr.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court on defense motion to modify bail.
Bail bond hearing proceeded.   Arguments heard by defense and the State. 
Court DENIED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record
 Case remains calendared in Branch 19 for a Scheduling Conference September 22, 2022 at 1:30pm.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for level 4 Supervision and all previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Ezzie Lamont Washington in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Ezzie Lamont Washington in custody.  
William R. F. Ackell for Stephan Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court on defense motion to modify bail. Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court GRANTED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record
Case remains calendared in Branch 19 for a Scheduling Conference on 9-22-2022 at 1:30pm.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bond.

Defendant Ezzie Lamont Washington in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Ezzie Lamont Washington in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Martin. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ezzie Lamont Washington not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ezzie Lamont Washington in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Ezzie Lamont Washington in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 1 AND 2 a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).
 This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
